alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Wayne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 23 at 6:29PM CDT until October 23 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WAYNE AND SOUTHEASTERN CEDAR COUNTIES... At 628 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 3 miles south of Laurel, or 9 miles north of Wayne, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Public. At 601 PM, a weather station 4 miles east of Pierce measured a wind gust up to 72 mph. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Wayne and southeastern Cedar Counties, including the following locations... Camp Assurance and Sholes. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
